Description: Limestone ostracon: on one side only, five lines of a literary text containing the beginning of a teaching written by the steward of Per-Ramses, Piay, and a duplicate text of P. Lansing 8, 8—9. At the end of the last line a date is written in red, above which is the remark 'in this place' in black, comparable to similar notations in the necropolis journals.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: J. J. Černy and A.H. Gardiner, ‘Hieratic Ostraca’ (Oxford 1957), p. 12 and pl. XLI, 1; R.A. Caminos, 'Late-Egyptian Miscellanies' (Oxford, 1954), pp. 40off. (P. Lansing).
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393764) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393764)
